meanings.definition: Organizing or preparing for action or use
meanings.sent1: The team is mobilising for the big game this weekend.
meanings.sent2: The community is mobilising to clean up the park together.
meanings.sent3: The ants were mobilising their forces to protect their queen.
meanings.sent4: The students were mobilising their resources for the science fair.
meanings.sent5: Mobilising our efforts will help us achieve our goal faster.

meanings.definition: Making something mobile or capable of movement
meanings.sent1: The new wheels made the chair more mobilising for the elderly.
meanings.sent2: The lightweight design of the drone made it highly mobilising.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel found the acorn to be quite mobilising for its snack.
meanings.sent4: The wind turbine's blades were mobilising in the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The rocket's boosters were incredibly mobilising during takeoff.
